object-oriented.text: I am highly experienced with object-oriented programming, having taken multiple courses in C and C++. These courses have involved group projects in which I have taken the role of team lead and have also designed the structure of the entire multi-thousand line program.

front-end-web.text: I have considerable background in front-end web development having worked multiple jobs in the field using Javascript, CSS and HTML5, as well as other technologies such as Typescript, Coffeescript, Less, AngularJS, node.js, and Electron. I also have experience building browser extensions for Google Chrome.

back-end-web.text: During my second co-op term I wrote back-end code on a stack of Ruby on Rails, Docker and AWS (specifically ECS, EC2, EB and SQS). I also wrote unit tests using RSpec and FactoryGirl, and defined my team's style guide for testing application code.

operating-systems.text: At past companies I have developed on all of Windows, OS X and Unix/Linux environments and would consider myself comfortable coding on each of them. Through school I have learned Racket, a functional language based on Scheme, and Bash scripting, which I have also used in the workplace.

version-control.text: I have worked extensively with several version control softwares such as Git, Github and Mercurial in the contexts of university classes, independent projects and work environments. I have also researched into these technologies for past work term reports.

research-projects.text: At all my previous companies I have worked on research projects, quickly producing detailed proof-of-concepts for technologies such as Electron, Aurelia, Parsehub and the Google Web Speech API. At Flipp I researched a long-standing issue surrounding stale database locks and designed a solution to fix it.
